channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Dynamic Spatial Sparsification for Efficient Vision Transformers and Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: We extend our method to hierarchical models including CNNs and hierarchical vision Transformers as well as more complex dense prediction tasks that require structured feature maps by formulating a more generic dynamic spatial sparsification framework with progressive sparsification and asymmetric computation for different spatial locations.

item.title: Vietnamese Capitalization and Punctuation Recovery Models
item.description: In this paper, we contribute a public dataset for capitalization and punctuation recovery for Vietnamese; and propose a joint model for both tasks named JointCapPunc.

item.title: Back to MLP: A Simple Baseline for Human Motion Prediction
item.description: This paper tackles the problem of human motion prediction, consisting in forecasting future body poses from historically observed sequences.

item.title: Task Discrepancy Maximization for Fine-grained Few-Shot Classification
item.description: Specifically, TDM learns task-specific channel weights based on two novel components: Support Attention Module (SAM) and Query Attention Module (QAM).

item.title: Approximate Vanishing Ideal Computations at Scale
item.description: The approximate vanishing ideal of a set of points $X = \{\mathbf{x}_1, \ldots, \mathbf{x}_m\}\subseteq [0, 1]^n$ is the set of polynomials that approximately evaluate to $0$ over all points $\mathbf{x} \in X$ and admits an efficient representation by a finite set of polynomials called generators.

item.title: Invariant and Transportable Representations for Anti-Causal Domain Shifts
item.description: In this paper, we study representation learning under a particular notion of domain shift that both respects causal invariance and that naturally handles the "anti-causal" structure.

item.title: Harmonizer: Learning to Perform White-Box Image and Video Harmonization
item.description: Unlike prior methods that are based on black-box autoencoders, Harmonizer contains a neural network for filter argument prediction and several white-box filters (based on the predicted arguments) for image harmonization.

item.title: Transferring Textual Knowledge for Visual Recognition
item.description: In this study, we focus on transferring knowledge for vision classification tasks.

item.title: Comparing Feature Importance and Rule Extraction for Interpretability on Text Data
item.description: Complex machine learning algorithms are used more and more often in critical tasks involving text data, leading to the development of interpretability methods.

item.title: Open-world Semantic Segmentation for LIDAR Point Clouds
item.description: Current methods for LIDAR semantic segmentation are not robust enough for real-world applications, e. g., autonomous driving, since it is closed-set and static.

item.title: Solving the Traveling Salesperson Problem with Precedence Constraints by Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this work, we generalize this concept of heterogeneous attentions to the TSPPC.

item.title: Large-scale Robustness Analysis of Video Action Recognition Models
item.description: The study reveals some interesting findings, 1) transformer based models are consistently more robust against most of the perturbations when compared with CNN based models, 2) Pretraining helps Transformer based models to be more robust to different perturbations than CNN based models, and 3) All of the studied models are robust to temporal perturbation on the Kinetics dataset, but not on SSv2; this suggests temporal information is much more important for action label prediction on SSv2 datasets than on the Kinetics dataset.

item.title: A New Index for Clustering Evaluation Based on Density Estimation
item.description: An experiment is conducted to test the performance of the new index, and compared with three popular internal clustering evaluation indices -- Calinski-Harabasz index, Silhouette coefficient, and Davies-Bouldin index, on a set of 145 datasets.

item.title: Learning Optimal Transport Between two Empirical Distributions with Normalizing Flows
item.description: Each of these functions is associated to one sub-flow of the network, whose output provides intermediate steps of the transport between the original and target measures.

item.title: Variational Neural Networks
item.description: Bayesian Neural Networks (BNNs) provide a tool to estimate the uncertainty of a neural network by considering a distribution over weights and sampling different models for each input.

item.title: Deep Contrastive One-Class Time Series Anomaly Detection
item.description: The accumulation of time series data and the absence of labels make time-series Anomaly Detection (AD) a self-supervised deep learning task.

item.title: Detection of ADHD based on Eye Movements during Natural Viewing
item.description: Attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a neurodevelopmental disorder that is highly prevalent and requires clinical specialists to diagnose.

item.title: Partial and Asymmetric Contrastive Learning for Out-of-Distribution Detection in Long-Tailed Recognition
item.description: However, in real-world applications, it is common for the training sets to have long-tailed distributions.

item.title: Understanding Performance of Long-Document Ranking Models through Comprehensive Evaluation and Leaderboarding
item.description: We carry out a comprehensive evaluation of 13 recent models for ranking of long documents using two popular collections (MS MARCO documents and Robust04).

item.title: TANet: Transformer-based Asymmetric Network for RGB-D Salient Object Detection
item.description: We employ the powerful feature extraction capability of Transformer (PVTv2) to extract global semantic information from RGB data and design a lightweight CNN backbone (LWDepthNet) to extract spatial structure information from depth data without pre-training.

item.title: CPrune: Compiler-Informed Model Pruning for Efficient Target-Aware DNN Execution
item.description: We propose CPrune, a compiler-informed model pruning for efficient target-aware DNN execution to support an application with a required target accuracy.

item.title: Aug-NeRF: Training Stronger Neural Radiance Fields with Triple-Level Physically-Grounded Augmentations
item.description: Inspired by that, we propose Augmented NeRF (Aug-NeRF), which for the first time brings the power of robust data augmentations into regularizing the NeRF training.

item.title: DeepPyramid: Enabling Pyramid View and Deformable Pyramid Reception for Semantic Segmentation in Cataract Surgery Videos
item.description: Semantic segmentation in cataract surgery has a wide range of applications contributing to surgical outcome enhancement and clinical risk reduction.

item.title: Disentangling Random and Cyclic Effects in Time-Lapse Sequences
item.description: We introduce the problem of disentangling time-lapse sequences in a way that allows separate, after-the-fact control of overall trends, cyclic effects, and random effects in the images, and describe a technique based on data-driven generative models that achieves this goal.

item.title: Removing Batch Normalization Boosts Adversarial Training
item.description: In addition, NoFrost achieves a $23. 56\%$ adversarial robustness against PGD attack, which improves the $13. 57\%$ robustness in BN-based AT.

item.title: Egocentric Video-Language Pretraining @ EPIC-KITCHENS-100 Multi-Instance Retrieval Challenge 2022
item.description: In this report, we propose a video-language pretraining (VLP) based solution \cite{kevin2022egovlp} for the EPIC-KITCHENS-100 Multi-Instance Retrieval (MIR) challenge.

item.title: Divert More Attention to Vision-Language Tracking
item.description: By revealing the potential of VL representation, we expect the community to divert more attention to VL tracking and hope to open more possibilities for future tracking beyond Transformer.

item.title: Sub-cluster-aware Network for Few-shot Skin Disease Classification
item.description: Specifically, SCAN follows a dual-branch framework, where the first branch is to learn class-wise features to distinguish different skin diseases, and the second one aims to learn features which can effectively partition each class into several groups so as to preserve the sub-clustered structure within each class.

item.title: You Only Need One Detector: Unified Object Detector for Different Modalities based on Vision Transformers
item.description: In this article, we further find out that by using a vision transformer together with cross/inter modality transfer learning, a unified detector can achieve better performances when using different modalities as inputs.

item.title: Learning Noise with Generative Adversarial Networks: Explorations with Classical Random Process Models
item.description: Random noise arising from physical processes is an inherent characteristic of measurements and a limiting factor for most signal processing tasks.

item.title: Saliency-Regularized Deep Multi-Task Learning
item.description: Specifically, we propose to model the task relation as the similarity between task input gradients, with a theoretical analysis of their equivalency.

item.title: Exploiting Context Information for Generic Event Boundary Captioning
item.description: Previous methods only process the information of a single boundary at a time, which lacks utilization of video context information.

item.title: WaferSegClassNet -- A Light-weight Network for Classification and Segmentation of Semiconductor Wafer Defects
item.description: WSCN has a model size of only 0. 51MB and performs only 0. 2M FLOPS.

item.title: Generating Repetitions with Appropriate Repeated Words
item.description: A repetition is a response that repeats words in the previous speaker's utterance in a dialogue.

item.title: PrUE: Distilling Knowledge from Sparse Teacher Networks
item.description: Besides, our method allows researchers to distill knowledge from deeper networks to improve students further.

item.title: An Empirical Evaluation of $k$-Means Coresets
item.description: Using this benchmark and real-world data sets, we conduct an exhaustive evaluation of the most commonly used coreset algorithms from theory and practice.

item.title: An Empirical Survey on Long Document Summarization: Datasets, Models and Metrics
item.description: The empirical analysis includes a study on the intrinsic characteristics of benchmark datasets, a multi-dimensional analysis of summarization models, and a review of the summarization evaluation metrics.

item.title: Variational Deep Image Restoration
item.description: This paper presents a new variational inference framework for image restoration and a convolutional neural network (CNN) structure that can solve the restoration problems described by the proposed framework.

item.title: Counterfactually Measuring and Eliminating Social Bias in Vision-Language Pre-training Models
item.description: Vision-Language Pre-training (VLP) models have achieved state-of-the-art performance in numerous cross-modal tasks.

item.title: Can Language Understand Depth?
item.description: To our best knowledge, we are the first to conduct zero-shot adaptation from the semantic language knowledge to quantified downstream tasks and perform zero-shot monocular depth estimation.

item.title: NP-Match: When Neural Processes meet Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: Semi-supervised learning (SSL) has been widely explored in recent years, and it is an effective way of leveraging unlabeled data to reduce the reliance on labeled data.

item.title: DailyTalk: Spoken Dialogue Dataset for Conversational Text-to-Speech
item.description: We sampled, modified, and recorded 2, 541 dialogues from the open-domain dialogue dataset DailyDialog which are adequately long to represent context of each dialogue.

item.title: Boundary-Guided Camouflaged Object Detection
item.description: Camouflaged object detection (COD), segmenting objects that are elegantly blended into their surroundings, is a valuable yet challenging task.

item.title: Hardware architecture for high throughput event visual data filtering with matrix of IIR filters algorithm
item.description: Neuromorphic vision is a rapidly growing field with numerous applications in the perception systems of autonomous vehicles.

item.title: CoVA: Exploiting Compressed-Domain Analysis to Accelerate Video Analytics
item.description: This paper presents CoVA, a novel cascade architecture that splits the cascade computation between compressed domain and pixel domain to address the decoding bottleneck, supporting both temporal and spatial queries.

item.title: Abstraction and Refinement: Towards Scalable and Exact Verification of Neural Networks
item.description: Our approach is orthogonal to and can be integrated with many existing verification techniques.

item.title: Sequence-aware multimodal page classification of Brazilian legal documents
item.description: The Brazilian Supreme Court receives tens of thousands of cases each semester.

item.title: Test-time Adaptation with Calibration of Medical Image Classification Nets for Label Distribution Shift
item.description: In this paper, we propose the first method to tackle label shift for medical image classification, which effectively adapt the model learned from a single training label distribution to arbitrary unknown test label distribution.

item.title: FL-Defender: Combating Targeted Attacks in Federated Learning
item.description: This makes it possible i) to train more accurate models due to learning from rich joint training data, and ii) to improve privacy by not sharing the workers' local private data with others.

item.title: SKIPP'D: a SKy Images and Photovoltaic Power Generation Dataset for Short-term Solar Forecasting
item.description: The dataset contains three years (2017-2019) of quality-controlled down-sampled sky images and PV power generation data that is ready-to-use for short-term solar forecasting using deep learning.
